within the PSAs viewers are offered a free booklet entitled tobacco helping youth say no since its release last year more than 180,000 copies have been distributed according to one of its authors the book that provides important Communications techniques for adult Role Models the booklet tobacco helping youth say no is a very practical guide for parents to use with their children as they work with them and learning about peer pressure and teaching their youngsters how to say no

no to a number of activities it's been very very well received funding for the TV PSAs the booklet and other related efforts was provided through a series of Grants from the tobacco Institute which in the last year has expanded the industry's ongoing commitment to programs to help discourage youth smoking some of the initiatives in the tobacco Institute program include an education campaign called it's the law for retailers so cigarettes are not sold to young people

support for new state laws that set a minimum age of 18 for cigarette sales backing the enactment of state laws that limit youth access to cigarette vending machines and curbing cigarette ads on Billboard's in areas near schools and children's playgrounds some 13 months ago The Institute announced that we were going to significantly expand our youth initiatives and in fact over those lasting 13 months we've had a tremendous amount of success we've helped pass

laws and in States across the country to raise the age to 18 before you can buy cigarettes we put supervision of vending machines into law in a number of states over 200,000 parents and other adults have received tobacco helping youth say no and over a million pieces of our retail kits it's the law telling retailers and the communities that they serve that it's illegal for children to buy cigarettes are out there so we're very excited with that success but
